channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2025020445
item.description:
Report X-2025020445

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-10
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Unload managers noticed that a plastic bubble-mailer envelope recently placed on the IC belt in the unload was smoking. A manager ripped it open and found that the package contained six boxes of safety matches. One of the boxes had caught on fire. The manager blew out the fire and alerted the DG Nav specialist, who was in the middle of processing hazmats. DG Nav specialist isolated the damaged package on a metal rack where it could not spread fire if it were to catch on fire again. The matches in the one box appear to be mostly or fully "used" given the burnt appearance. The other five boxes are in acceptable condition.

item.title: Report X-2025020310
item.description:
Report X-2025020310

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-04
  • City: VIRGINIA
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING PACKAGE HANDLING, A RATTLING AEROSOL NOISE WAS HEARD COMING FROM ONE AIR PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED FOUR FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF FILL-ONE MASTERBLEND, EACH AT 16 OZ. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED BY AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
